info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:43PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL AND SOUTH CENTRAL MORA COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 442 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Las Vegas, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Las Vegas, Storrie Lake State Park, Romeroville, Los Montoyas and San Agustin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 337 and 365. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 1 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.
